children.subject: Good question! Since seats are limited, only students registered for the course right now should enroll in CSM sections.
Are future students allowed to sign up for CSM section? (Like student who are not registered for the class but will take in the future.)

history.content:
Hi everyone!

Computer Science Mentors (CSM) will be running small group discussion sections for EECS 16A, EECS 16B, CS 70, CS 88, CS 61A, CS 61B, and CS 61C this semester!

 

The CSM adjunct section is an additional discussion section with smaller groups that offers more individual attention than is available in large classes. The discussion sections will feature worksheets which will cover selected topics from the respective course. The worksheet will typically follow material presented in lecture a week before the section. The purpose of these sections is to create a stronger feeling of community in classes and reinforce conceptual understanding of course material. Please refrain from asking questions pertinent to homework, projects, and exams during sections.

 

Mentors are not necessarily official course staff but are fellow undergraduates who have taken the course and are volunteering their time and energy to create a better community for students.

 

Requirements

  • Read full Student Expectations here

  • Spring 2020: Mentoring sections begin the week of February 9th for EECS 16A, EECS 16B, CS 70, CS 88, CS 61B, and CS 61C. CS 61A will begin the week of February 17th.

  • Fill out 2 feedback surveys: one mid-semester, one at the end of the semester.

  • You must attend the first 3 weeks of section! Unexcused absences in the first 3 weeks will result in automatically being dropped from section. If you are taking the course for a unit, this will result in an NP. 

  • After the first 3 weeks, you may have up to 2 unexcused absences; more than 2 will result in an NP if you are taking the course for units. Additionally, you may be dropped from your section.

  • If you have a reason for an absence, you must email your mentor to excuse your absence with the subject line: “[Request for Absence] <course>” and cc mentors@berkeley.edu

  • Join your respective course's CSM Piazza for announcements and additional materials including worksheet solutions.

  • You have the option of taking this course for 1 P/NP unit. For Spring 2020 only (note that CCNs change every semester): The CCN is 33599 and the section number is CS197-215. If you have trouble finding it on CalCentral, search by Class Number (33599) from the shopping cart. Make sure you are enrolling in section 215. Please do not sign up for any CS197 except for 215! We only control the P/NP grades for 215. If you sign up for a different one, they will NP you.

    • You are responsible for adding the unit yourself on CalCentral. If you decide you do not want to to earn the unit for CSM, you must drop the course on CalCentral by your college’s add/drop deadline. Dropping yourself on Scheduler does not automatically drop you on CalCentral.

    • To receive a P, you must complete all the requirements above, including filling out two feedback forms and attending sections regularly.

    • Note: If you have too many unexcused absences, you will be dropped from section on Scheduler, not on CalCentral. If you are taking the course for a unit, this will result in an NP. 

Sign-ups are open at https://scheduler.csmentors.org/ and will be first-come, first-serve. Mentors bios are available on our website to help you choose a mentor: https://csmentors.berkeley.edu/#/bios. 

FAQ here: bit.ly/csm-sp20-faq

Email mentors@berkeley.edu if you have any additional questions.
